<tr><td>Linux</td><td><code>$XDG_DATA_HOME</code>/ord or <code>$HOME</code>/.local/share/ord</td><td>/home/alice/.local/share/ord</td></tr>
<tr><td>macOS</td><td><code>$HOME</code>/Library/Application Support/ord</td><td>/Users/Alice/Library/Application Support/ord</td></tr>
<tr><td>Windows</td><td><code>{FOLDERID_RoamingAppData}</code>\ord</td><td>C:\Users\Alice\AppData\Roaming\ord</td></tr>
</tbody></table>
</div>
<p>Para eliminar la base de datos y reindexar en MacOS, tendrías que ejecutar los siguientes comandos en la terminal:</p>
<pre><code class="language-bash">rm ~/Library/Application Support/ord/index.redb
ord index update
</code></pre>
<p>También tienes la opción de determinar la ubicación del directorio de datos utilizando el comando <code>ord --data-dir &lt;DIR&gt; index update</code> o asignarle un nombre de archivo y ruta específicos utilizando el comando <code>ord --index &lt;NOMBRE_DE_ARCHIVO&gt; index update</code>.</p>
<div style="break-before: page; page-break-before: always;"></div><h1 id="pistas-para-la-caza-de-recompensas-de-ordinals"><a class="header" href="#pistas-para-la-caza-de-recompensas-de-ordinals">Pistas para la Caza de Recompensas de Ordinals</a></h1>
<ul>
<li>
<p>El monedero <code>ord</code> tiene la capacidad de enviar y recibir satoshis específicos. Además, la teoría ordinal es sumamente sencilla. Un hacker ingenioso debería poder crear código desde cero para manipular satoshis utilizando la teoría ordinal en poco tiempo.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Para obtener más información sobre la teoría ordinal, visita la sección de <a href="./faq.html">preguntas frecuentes</a> para obtener una visión general, el <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord/blob/master/bip.mediawiki">BIP</a> para los detalles técnicos, y el <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord">repositorio de ord</a> para conocer más sobre el monedero y el explorador de bloques de <code>ord</code>.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Satoshi fue el desarrollador original de la teoría ordinal. Sin embargo, sabía que otros la considerarían herética y peligrosa, por lo que ocultó su conocimiento, que terminó desapareciendo con el paso del tiempo. Solo ahora estamos redescubriendo esta poderosa teoría. Puedes contribuir con este resurgimiento investigando satoshis poco comunes.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>¡Buena suerte y buen viaje!</p>
<div style="break-before: page; page-break-before: always;"></div><h1 id="recompensa-ordinal-0"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-ordinal-0">Recompensa Ordinal 0</a></h1>
<h2 id="criterios"><a class="header" href="#criterios">Criterios</a></h2>
<p>Envía un sat cuyo número ordinal termine en cero a la dirección de entrega:</p>
<p>✅: <a href="https://ordinals.com/ordinal/1857578125803250">1857578125803250</a></p>
<p>❌: <a href="https://ordinals.com/ordinal/1857578125803251">1857578125803251</a></p>
<p>El sat debe ser el primer sat de la salida que envíes.</p>
<h2 id="recompensa"><a class="header" href="#recompensa">Recompensa</a></h2>
<p>100,000 sats</p>
<h2 id="dirección-de-entrega"><a class="header" href="#dirección-de-entrega">Dirección de Entrega</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://mempool.space/address/1PE7u4wbDP2RqfKN6geD1bG57v9Gj9FXm3"><code>1PE7u4wbDP2RqfKN6geD1bG57v9Gj9FXm3</code></a></p>
<h2 id="estado"><a class="header" href="#estado">Estado</a></h2>
<p>Reclamado por <a href="https://twitter.com/rodarmor/status/1560793241473400833">@count_null</a>!</p>
<div style="break-before: page; page-break-before: always;"></div><h1 id="recompensa-ordinal-1"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-ordinal-1">Recompensa Ordinal 1</a></h1>
<h2 id="criterios-1"><a class="header" href="#criterios-1">Criterios</a></h2>
<p>La transacción que envíe un UTXO que contenga el sat más antiguo, es decir, aquel con el número más bajo, entre todos los UTXOs enviados será considerado el ganador.</p>
<p>La convocatoria para participar en la recompensa permanecerá abierta hasta el bloque 753984, que marca el primer bloque del período de ajuste de dificultad 374. Los envíos que se incluyan a partir del bloque 753984 no serán tomados en cuenta.</p>
<h2 id="recompensa-1"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-1">Recompensa</a></h2>
<p>200,000 sats</p>
<h2 id="dirección-de-entrega-1"><a class="header" href="#dirección-de-entrega-1">Dirección de Entrega</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://mempool.space/address/145Z7PFHyVrwiMWwEcUmDgFbmUbQSU9aap"><code>145Z7PFHyVrwiMWwEcUmDgFbmUbQSU9aap</code></a></p>
<h2 id="estado-1"><a class="header" href="#estado-1">Estado</a></h2>
<p>Reclamado por <a href="https://twitter.com/rodarmor/status/1569883266508853251">@ordinalsindex</a>!</p>
<div style="break-before: page; page-break-before: always;"></div><h1 id="recompensa-ordinal-2"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-ordinal-2">Recompensa Ordinal 2</a></h1>
<h2 id="criterios-2"><a class="header" href="#criterios-2">Criterios</a></h2>
<p>Send an <span class=uncommon>uncommon</span> sat to the submission address:</p>
<p>✅: <a href="https://ordinals.com/sat/347100000000000">347100000000000</a></p>
<p>❌: <a href="https://ordinals.com/sat/6685000001337">6685000001337</a></p>
<p>Confirma que la dirección de entrega no haya recibido transacciones antes de enviar tu entrega. Solo la primera participación exitosa recibirá recompensa.</p>
<h2 id="recompensa-2"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-2">Recompensa</a></h2>
<p>300,000 sats</p>
<h2 id="dirección-de-entrega-2"><a class="header" href="#dirección-de-entrega-2">Dirección de Entrega</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://mempool.space/address/1Hyr94uypwWq5CQffaXHvwUMEyBPp3TUZH"><code>1Hyr94uypwWq5CQffaXHvwUMEyBPp3TUZH</code></a></p>
<h2 id="estado-2"><a class="header" href="#estado-2">Estado</a></h2>
<p>Reclamado por <a href="https://twitter.com/rodarmor/status/1582424455615172608">@utxoset</a>!</p>
<div style="break-before: page; page-break-before: always;"></div><h1 id="recompensa-ordinal-3"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-ordinal-3">Recompensa Ordinal 3</a></h1>
<h2 id="criterios-3"><a class="header" href="#criterios-3">Criterios</a></h2>
<p>La tercera recompensa ordinal consta de dos partes, ambas basadas en los <em>nombres de ordinals</em>. Los nombres de los ordinals son una modificación de la codificación base-26 de los números ordinales. Para prevenir que los nombres más cortos queden atrapados en el bloque génesis el cual no se puede utilizar, los nombres de los ordinals se van acortando a medida que el número ordinal aumenta. El nombre del sat 0, el primer sat minado, es <code>nvtdijuwxlp</code> y el nombre del sat 2,099,999,997,689,999, el último sat que será minado, es <code>a</code>.</p>
<p>La convocatoria para participar en la recompensa permanecerá abierta hasta el bloque 840000, el primer bloque después del cuarto halving. Los envíos que se incluyan a partir del bloque 840000 no serán tomados en cuenta.</p>
<p>Ambas partes usan <a href="bounty/frequency.tsv">frequency.tsv</a>, un documento que contiene una lista de palabras junto con la cantidad de veces que aparecen en el <a href="http://storage.googleapis.com/books/ngrams/books/datasetsv2.html">set de datos Google Books Ngram</a>, Este archivo ha sido filtrado para incluir solo los nombres de sats que habrán sido minados para el momento de cierre del periodo de entregas, que aparecen por lo menos 5000 veces en el corpus.</p>
<p><code>frequency.tsv</code> es un archivo de valores separados por tabulaciones. La primera columna es la palabra, y la segunda es el número de veces que aparece en el corpus. Los datos están organizados de manera que las palabras que aparecen con menor frecuencia están primero, seguidas por aquellas que se encuentran con una mayor frecuencia.</p>
<p><code>frequency.tsv</code> fue compilado <a href="https://github.com/casey/onegrams">usando este programa</a>.</p>
<p>Para buscar sats en un monedero <code>ord</code> que coincidan con un nombre presente en <code>frequency.tsv</code>, emplea el siguiente comando <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord"><code>ord</code></a>:</p>
<pre><code>ord wallet sats --tsv frequency.tsv
</code></pre>
<p>Este comando requiere el índice de sats, por lo que se debe incluir el parámetro <code>--index-sats</code> en ord cuando se crea el índice por primera vez.</p>
<h3 id="parte-0"><a class="header" href="#parte-0">Parte 0</a></h3>
<p><em>Los sats raros hacen mejor pareja con palabras raras.</em></p>
<p>La transacción que envíe el UTXO que contiene el sat cuyo nombre aparece con el menor número de ocurrencias en <code>frequency.tsv</code> será el ganador de la parte 0.</p>
<h3 id="parte-1"><a class="header" href="#parte-1">Parte 1</a></h3>
<p><em>La popularidad es la fuente del valor.</em></p>
<p>La transacción que envía el UTXO que contiene el sat cuyo nombre aparece con el mayor número de ocurrencias en <code>frequency.tsv</code> será el ganador de la parte 1.</p>
<h3 id="desempate"><a class="header" href="#desempate">Desempate</a></h3>
<p>Si se produce un empate, donde dos presentaciones registren la misma frecuencia, la presentación que se haya realizado primero será la ganadora. </p>
<h2 id="recompensa-3"><a class="header" href="#recompensa-3">Recompensa</a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Parte 0: 200,000 satoshis</li>
<li>Parte 1: 200,000 sats</li>
<li>Total: 400,000 sats</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="dirección-de-entrega-3"><a class="header" href="#dirección-de-entrega-3">Dirección de Entrega</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://mempool.space/address/17m5rvMpi78zG8RUpCRd6NWWMJtWmu65kg"><code>17m5rvMpi78zG8RUpCRd6NWWMJtWmu65kg</code></a></p>
<h2 id="estado-3"><a class="header" href="#estado-3">Estado</a></h2>
<p>¡No se ha reclamado!</p>

                    </main>

                    <nav class="nav-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">
                        <!-- Mobile navigation buttons -->


                        <div style="clear: both"></div>
                    </nav>
                </div>
            </div>

            <nav class="nav-wide-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">

            </nav>

        </div>

                    <main>
                        <h1 id="ordinal-theory-faq"><a class="header" href="#ordinal-theory-faq">Ordinal Theory FAQ</a></h1>
<h2 id="what-is-ordinal-theory"><a class="header" href="#what-is-ordinal-theory">What is ordinal theory?</a></h2>
<p>Ordinal theory is a protocol for assigning serial numbers to satoshis, the
smallest subdivision of a bitcoin, and tracking those satoshis as they are
spent by transactions.</p>
<p>These serial numbers are large numbers, like this 804766073970493. Every
satoshi, which is ¹⁄₁₀₀₀₀₀₀₀₀ of a bitcoin, has an ordinal number.</p>
<h2 id="does-ordinal-theory-require-a-side-chain-a-separate-token-or-changes-to-bitcoin"><a class="header" href="#does-ordinal-theory-require-a-side-chain-a-separate-token-or-changes-to-bitcoin">Does ordinal theory require a side chain, a separate token, or changes to Bitcoin?</a></h2>
<p>Nope! Ordinal theory works right now, without a side chain, and the only token
needed is bitcoin itself.</p>
<h2 id="what-is-ordinal-theory-good-for"><a class="header" href="#what-is-ordinal-theory-good-for">What is ordinal theory good for?</a></h2>
<p>Collecting, trading, and scheming. Ordinal theory assigns identities to
individual satoshis, allowing them to be individually tracked and traded, as
curios and for numismatic value.</p>
<p>Ordinal theory also enables inscriptions, a protocol for attaching arbitrary
content to individual satoshis, turning them into bitcoin-native digital
artifacts.</p>
<h2 id="how-does-ordinal-theory-work"><a class="header" href="#how-does-ordinal-theory-work">How does ordinal theory work?</a></h2>
<p>Ordinal numbers are assigned to satoshis in the order in which they are mined.
The first satoshi in the first block has ordinal number 0, the second has
ordinal number 1, and the last satoshi of the first block has ordinal number
4,999,999,999.</p>
<p>Satoshis live in outputs, but transactions destroy outputs and create new ones,
so ordinal theory uses an algorithm to determine how satoshis hop from the
inputs of a transaction to its outputs.</p>
<p>Fortunately, that algorithm is very simple.</p>
<p>Satoshis transfer in first-in-first-out order. Think of the inputs to a
transaction as being a list of satoshis, and the outputs as a list of slots,
waiting to receive a satoshi. To assign input satoshis to slots, go through
each satoshi in the inputs in order, and assign each to the first available
slot in the outputs.</p>
<p>Let's imagine a transaction with three inputs and two outputs. The inputs are
on the left of the arrow and the outputs are on the right, all labeled with
their values:</p>
<pre><code>[2] [1] [3] → [4] [2]
</code></pre>
<p>Now let's label the same transaction with the ordinal numbers of the satoshis
that each input contains, and question marks for each output slot. Ordinal
numbers are large, so let's use letters to represent them:</p>
<pre><code>[a b] [c] [d e f] → [? ? ? ?] [? ?]
</code></pre>
<p>To figure out which satoshi goes to which output, go through the input satoshis
in order and assign each to a question mark:</p>
<pre><code>[a b] [c] [d e f] → [a b c d] [e f]
</code></pre>
<p>What about fees, you might ask? Good question! Let's imagine the same
transaction, this time with a two satoshi fee. Transactions with fees send more
satoshis in the inputs than are received by the outputs, so to make our
transaction into one that pays fees, we'll remove the second output:</p>
<pre><code>[2] [1] [3] → [4]
</code></pre>
<p>The satoshis <var>e</var> and <var>f</var> now have nowhere to go in the
outputs:</p>
<pre><code>[a b] [c] [d e f] → [a b c d]
</code></pre>
<p>So they go to the miner who mined the block as fees. <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord/blob/master/bip.mediawiki">The
BIP</a> has the details,
but in short, fees paid by transactions are treated as extra inputs to the
coinbase transaction, and are ordered how their corresponding transactions are
ordered in the block. The coinbase transaction of the block might look like
this:</p>
<pre><code>[SUBSIDY] [e f] → [SUBSIDY e f]
</code></pre>
<h2 id="where-can-i-find-the-nitty-gritty-details"><a class="header" href="#where-can-i-find-the-nitty-gritty-details">Where can I find the nitty-gritty details?</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord/blob/master/bip.mediawiki">The BIP!</a></p>
<h2 id="why-are-sat-inscriptions-called-digital-artifacts-instead-of-nfts"><a class="header" href="#why-are-sat-inscriptions-called-digital-artifacts-instead-of-nfts">Why are sat inscriptions called &quot;digital artifacts&quot; instead of &quot;NFTs&quot;?</a></h2>
<p>An inscription is an NFT, but the term &quot;digital artifact&quot; is used instead,
because it's simple, suggestive, and familiar.</p>
<p>The phrase &quot;digital artifact&quot; is highly suggestive, even to someone who has
never heard the term before. In comparison, NFT is an acronym, and doesn't
provide any indication of what it means if you haven't heard the term before.</p>
<p>Additionally, &quot;NFT&quot; feels like financial terminology, and the both word
&quot;fungible&quot; and sense of the word &quot;token&quot; as used in &quot;NFT&quot; is uncommon outside
of financial contexts.</p>
<h2 id="how-do-sat-inscriptions-compare-to"><a class="header" href="#how-do-sat-inscriptions-compare-to">How do sat inscriptions compare to…</a></h2>
<h3 id="ethereum-nfts"><a class="header" href="#ethereum-nfts">Ethereum NFTs?</a></h3>
<p><em>Inscriptions are always immutable.</em></p>
<p>There is simply no way to for the creator of an inscription, or the owner of an
inscription, to modify it after it has been created.</p>
<p>Ethereum NFTs <em>can</em> be immutable, but many are not, and can be changed or
deleted by the NFT contract owner.</p>
<p>In order to make sure that a particular Ethereum NFT is immutable, the contract
code must be audited, which requires detailed knowledge of the EVM and Solidity
semantics.</p>
<p>It is very hard for a non-technical user to determine whether or not a given
Ethereum NFT is mutable or immutable, and Ethereum NFT platforms make no effort
to distinguish whether an NFT is mutable or immutable, and whether the contract
source code is available and has been audited.</p>
<p><em>Inscription content is always on-chain.</em></p>
<p>There is no way for an inscription to refer to off-chain content. This makes
inscriptions more durable, because content cannot be lost, and scarcer, because
inscription creators must pay fees proportional to the size of the content.</p>
<p>Some Ethereum NFT content is on-chain, but much is off-chain, and is stored on
platforms like IPFS or Arweave, or on traditional, fully centralized web
servers. Content on IPFS is not guaranteed to continue to be available, and
some NFT content stored on IPFS has already been lost. Platforms like Arweave
rely on weak economic assumptions, and will likely fail catastrophically when
these economic assumptions are no longer met. Centralized web servers may
disappear at any time.</p>
<p>It is very hard for a non-technical user to determine where the content of a
given Ethereum NFT is stored.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are much simpler.</em></p>
<p>Ethereum NFTs depend on the Ethereum network and virtual machine, which are
highly complex, constantly changing, and which introduce changes via
backwards-incompatible hard forks.</p>
<p>Inscriptions, on the other hand, depend on the Bitcoin blockchain, which is
relatively simple and conservative, and which introduces changes via
backwards-compatible soft forks.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are more secure.</em></p>
<p>Inscriptions inherit Bitcoin's transaction model, which allow a user to see
exactly which inscriptions are being transferred by a transaction before they
sign it. Inscriptions can be offered for sale using partially signed
transactions, which don't require allowing a third party, such as an exchange
or marketplace, to transfer them on the user's behalf.</p>
<p>By comparison, Ethereum NFTs are plagued with end-user security
vulnerabilities. It is commonplace to blind-sign transactions, grant
third-party apps unlimited permissions over a user's NFTs, and interact with
complex and unpredictable smart contracts. This creates a minefield of hazards
for Ethereum NFT users which are simply not a concern for ordinal theorists.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are scarcer.</em></p>
<p>Inscriptions require bitcoin to mint, transfer, and store. This seems like a
downside on the surface, but the raison d'etre of digital artifacts is to be
scarce and thus valuable.</p>
<p>Ethereum NFTs, on the other hand, can be minted in virtually unlimited
qualities with a single transaction, making them inherently less scarce, and
thus, potentially less valuable.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions do not pretend to support on-chain royalties.</em></p>
<p>On-chain royalties are a good idea in theory but not in practice. Royalty
payment cannot be enforced on-chain without complex and invasive restrictions.
The Ethereum NFT ecosystem is currently grappling with confusion around
royalties, and is collectively coming to grips with the reality that on-chain
royalties, which were messaged to artists as an advantage of NFTs, are not
possible, while platforms race to the bottom and remove royalty support.</p>
<p>Inscriptions avoid this situation entirely by making no false promises of
supporting royalties on-chain, thus avoiding the confusion, chaos, and
negativity of the Ethereum NFT situation.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions unlock new markets.</em></p>
<p>Bitcoin's market capitalization and liquidity are greater than Ethereum's by a
large margin. Much of this liquidity is not available to Ethereum NFTs, since
many Bitcoiners prefer not to interact with the Ethereum ecosystem due to
concerns related to simplicity, security, and decentralization.</p>
<p>Such Bitcoiners may be more interested in inscriptions than Ethereum NFTs,
unlocking new classes of collector.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions have a richer data model.</em></p>
<p>Inscriptions consist of a content type, also known as a MIME type, and content,
which is an arbitrary byte string. This is the same data model used by the web,
and allows inscription content to evolve with the web, and come to support any
kind of content supported by web browsers, without requiring changes to the
underlying protocol.</p>
<h3 id="rgb-and-taro-assets"><a class="header" href="#rgb-and-taro-assets">RGB and Taro assets?</a></h3>
<p>RGB and Taro are both second-layer asset protocols built on Bitcoin. Compared
to inscriptions, they are much more complicated, but much more featureful.</p>
<p>Ordinal theory has been designed from the ground up for digital artifacts,
whereas the primary use-case of RGB and Taro are fungible tokens, so the user
experience for inscriptions is likely to be simpler and more polished than the
user experience for RGB and Taro NFTs.</p>
<p>RGB and Taro both store content off-chain, which requires additional
infrastructure, and which may be lost. By contrast, inscription content is
stored on-chain, and cannot be lost.</p>
<p>Ordinal theory, RGB, and Taro are all very early, so this is speculation, but
ordinal theory's focus may give it the edge in terms of features for digital
artifacts, including a better content model, and features like globally unique
symbols.</p>
<h3 id="counterparty-assets"><a class="header" href="#counterparty-assets">Counterparty assets?</a></h3>
<p>Counterparty has its own token, XCP, which is required for some functionality,
which makes most bitcoiners regard it as an altcoin, and not an extension or
second layer for bitcoin.</p>
<p>Ordinal theory has been designed from the ground up for digital artifacts,
whereas Counterparty was primarily designed for financial token issuance.</p>
<h2 id="inscriptions-for"><a class="header" href="#inscriptions-for">Inscriptions for…</a></h2>
<h3 id="artists"><a class="header" href="#artists">Artists</a></h3>
<p><em>Inscriptions are on Bitcoin.</em> Bitcoin is the digital currency with the highest
status and greatest chance of long-term survival. If you want to guarantee that
your art survives into the future, there is no better way to publish it than as
inscriptions.</p>
<p><em>Cheaper on-chain storage.</em> At $20,000 per BTC and the minimum relay fee of 1
satoshi per vbyte, publishing inscription content costs $50 per 1 million
bytes.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are early!</em> Inscriptions are still in development, and have not
yet launched on mainnet. This gives you an opportunity to be an early adopter,
and explore the medium as it evolves.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are simple.</em> Inscriptions do not require writing or understanding
smart contracts.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions unlock new liquidity.</em> Inscriptions are more accessible and
appealing to bitcoin holders, unlocking an entirely new class of collector.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are designed for digital artifacts.</em> Inscriptions are designed
from the ground up to support NFTs, and feature a better data model, and
features like globally unique symbols and enhanced provenance.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions do not support on-chain royalties.</em> This is negative, but only
depending on how you look at it. On-chain royalties have been a boon for
creators, but have also created a huge amount of confusion in the Ethereum NFT
ecosystem. The ecosystem now grapples with this issue, and is engaged in a
race to the bottom, towards a royalties-optional future. Inscriptions have no
support for on-chain royalties, because they are technically infeasible. If you
choose to create inscriptions, there are many ways you can work around this
limitation: withhold a portion of your inscriptions for future sale, to benefit
from future appreciation, or perhaps offer perks for users who respect optional
royalties.</p>
<h3 id="collectors"><a class="header" href="#collectors">Collectors</a></h3>
<p><em>Inscriptions are simple, clear, and have no surprises.</em> They are always
immutable and on-chain, with no special due diligence required.</p>
<p><em>Inscriptions are on Bitcoin.</em> You can verify the location and properties of
inscriptions easily with Bitcoin full node that you control.</p>
<h3 id="bitcoiners"><a class="header" href="#bitcoiners">Bitcoiners</a></h3>
<p>Let me begin this section by saying: the most important thing that the Bitcoin
network does is decentralize money. All other use-cases are secondary,
including ordinal theory. The developers of ordinal theory understand and
acknowledge this, and believe that ordinal theory helps, at least in a small
way, Bitcoin's primary mission.</p>
<p>Unlike many other things in the altcoin space, digital artifacts have merit.
There are, of course, a great deal of NFTs that are ugly, stupid, and
fraudulent. However, there are many that are fantastically creative, and
creating and collecting art has been a part of the human story since its
inception, and predates even trade and money, which are also ancient
technologies.</p>
<p>Bitcoin provides an amazing platform for creating and collecting digital
artifacts in a secure, decentralized way, that protects users and artists in
the same way that it provides an amazing platform for sending and receiving
value, and for all the same reasons.</p>
<p>Ordinals and inscriptions increase demand for Bitcoin block space, which
increase Bitcoin's security budget, which is vital for safeguarding Bitcoin's
transition to a fee-dependent security model, as the block subsidy is halved
into insignificance.</p>
<p>Inscription content is stored on-chain, and thus the demand for block space for
use in inscriptions is unlimited. This creates a buyer of last resort for <em>all</em>
Bitcoin block space. This will help support a robust fee market, which ensures
that Bitcoin remains secure.</p>
<p>Inscriptions also counter the narrative that Bitcoin cannot be extended or used
for new use-cases. If you follow projects like DLCs, Fedimint, Lightning, Taro,
and RGB, you know that this narrative is false, but inscriptions provide a
counter argument which is easy to understand, and which targets a popular and
proven use case, NFTs, which makes it highly legible.</p>
<p>If inscriptions prove, as the authors hope, to be highly sought after digital
artifacts with a rich history, they will serve as a powerful hook for Bitcoin
adoption: come for the fun, rich art, stay for the decentralized digital money.</p>
<p>Inscriptions are an extremely benign source of demand for block space. Unlike,
for example, stablecoins, which potentially give large stablecoin issuers
influence over the future of Bitcoin development, or DeFi, which might
centralize mining by introducing opportunities for MEV, digital art and
collectables on Bitcoin, are unlikely to produce individual entities with
enough power to corrupt Bitcoin. Art is decentralized.</p>
<p>Inscription users and service providers are incentivized to run Bitcoin full
nodes, to publish and track inscriptions, and thus throw their economic weight
behind the honest chain.</p>
<p>Ordinal theory and inscriptions do not meaningfully affect Bitcoin's
fungibility. Bitcoin users can ignore both and be unaffected.</p>
<p>We hope that ordinal theory strengthens and enriches bitcoin, and gives it
another dimension of appeal and functionality, enabling it more effectively
serve its primary use case as humanity's decentralized store of value.</p>

                    </main>

            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));

        </script>

                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>

                    <h1 class="menu-title">Ordinal Theory Handbook</h1>

                    <div class="right-buttons">
                        <button id="language-toggle" class="icon-button" type="button"
                                title="Change language" aria-label="Change language"
                                aria-haspopup="true" aria-expanded="false"
                                aria-controls="language-list">
                            <i class="fa fa-globe"></i>
                        </button>
                        <ul id="language-list" class="theme-popup" aria-label="Languages" role="menu">
                          <li role="none"><button role="menuitem" class="theme">
                              <a id="en">English</a>
                          </button></li>
                          <li role="none"><button role="menuitem" class="theme">
                              <a id="de">Deutsch</a>
                          </button></li>
                          <li role="none"><button role="menuitem" class="theme">
                              <a id="fr">Français</a>

                        <script>
                          let langToggle = document.getElementById("language-toggle");
                          let langList = document.getElementById("language-list");
                          langToggle.addEventListener("click", (event) => {
                              langList.style.display = langList.style.display == "block" ? "none" : "block";
                          });

                          let path = "404.md".replace(/\.md$/, ".html");

<!DOCTYPE HTML>
<html lang="fil" class="coal" dir="ltr">
    <head>
        <!-- Book generated using mdBook -->
        <meta charset="UTF-8">
        <title>Bounties - Ordinal Theory Handbook</title>


        <!-- Custom HTML head -->
        
        <meta name="description" content="">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">

        <link rel="icon" href="favicon.svg">
        <link rel="shortcut icon" href="favicon.png">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/variables.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/general.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/chrome.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="css/print.css" media="print">

        <!-- Fonts -->
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="FontAwesome/css/font-awesome.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="fonts/fonts.css">

        <!-- Highlight.js Stylesheets -->
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="highlight.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="tomorrow-night.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="ayu-highlight.css">

    <body class="sidebar-visible no-js">
    <div id="body-container">
        <!-- Provide site root to javascript -->
        <script>
            var path_to_root = "";
            var default_theme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches ? "coal" : "coal";
        </script>

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

        <input type="checkbox" id="sidebar-toggle-anchor" class="hidden">

        <!-- Hide / unhide sidebar before it is displayed -->
        <script>
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            var sidebar = null;
            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

        <!-- Track and set sidebar scroll position -->
        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>

                    <main>
                        <h1 id="ordinal-bounty-hunting-hints"><a class="header" href="#ordinal-bounty-hunting-hints">Ordinal Bounty Hunting Hints</a></h1>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Ang <code>ord</code> wallet ay maaaring magpadala at tumanggap ng partikular na satoshi. Gayundin, ang ordinal theory ay napakasimple. Ang isang matalinong hacker ay dapat na makapagsulat ng code mula sa simula upang manipulahin ang mga satoshi gamit ang ordinal theory.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Para sa higit pang impormasyon sa Ordinal Theory, tingnan ang FAQ para sa isang pangkalahatang-ideya, ang <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord/blob/master/bip.mediawiki">BIP</a> para sa mga teknikal na detalye, at ang <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord">ord repository</a> para sa ord wallet at block explorer.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Satoshi ang unang bumuo ng Ordinal Theory. Gayunpaman, alam niyang ituturing siya ng iba na erehe at mapanganib, kaya itinago niya ang kanyang kaalaman at nawala ito sa paglipas panahon. Ang makapangyarihang teoryang ito ay ngayon lamang muling natuklasan. Maaari kang mag-ambag dito sa pamamagitan ng paghahanap ng mga bihirang satoshi.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Good luck and godspeed!</p>

                    </main>

                    <nav class="nav-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">
                        <!-- Mobile navigation buttons -->
                            <a rel="prev" href="guides/reindexing.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters previous" title="Previous chapter" aria-label="Previous chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Left">
                                <i class="fa fa-angle-left"></i>
                            </a>

                            <a rel="next prefetch" href="bounty/0.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters next" title="Next chapter" aria-label="Next chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Right">
                                <i class="fa fa-angle-right"></i>
                            </a>

                        <div style="clear: both"></div>
                    </nav>
                </div>
            </div>

                    <a rel="prev" href="guides/reindexing.html" class="nav-chapters previous" title="Previous chapter" aria-label="Previous chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Left">
                        <i class="fa fa-angle-left"></i>

<!DOCTYPE HTML>
<html lang="fil" class="coal" dir="ltr">
    <head>
        <!-- Book generated using mdBook -->
        <meta charset="UTF-8">
        <title>Bounty 0: 100,000 sats Claimed! - Ordinal Theory Handbook</title>


        <!-- Custom HTML head -->
        
        <meta name="description" content="">
        <meta name="viewport" content="width=device-width, initial-scale=1">
        <meta name="theme-color" content="#ffffff">

        <link rel="icon" href="../favicon.svg">
        <link rel="shortcut icon" href="../favicon.png">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../css/variables.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../css/general.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../css/chrome.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../css/print.css" media="print">

        <!-- Fonts -->
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../FontAwesome/css/font-awesome.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../fonts/fonts.css">

        <!-- Highlight.js Stylesheets -->
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../highlight.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../tomorrow-night.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../ayu-highlight.css">

        <!-- Custom theme stylesheets -->
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../language-picker.css">

    </head>
    <body class="sidebar-visible no-js">
    <div id="body-container">
        <!-- Provide site root to javascript -->
        <script>
            var path_to_root = "../";
            var default_theme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches ? "coal" : "coal";
        </script>

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

        <input type="checkbox" id="sidebar-toggle-anchor" class="hidden">

        <!-- Hide / unhide sidebar before it is displayed -->
        <script>
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            var sidebar = null;
            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

        <!-- Track and set sidebar scroll position -->
        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>

                        <script>
                          let langToggle = document.getElementById("language-toggle");
                          let langList = document.getElementById("language-list");
                          langToggle.addEventListener("click", (event) => {
                              langList.style.display = langList.style.display == "block" ? "none" : "block";
                          });
                          let selectedLang = document.getElementById("fil");
                          if (selectedLang) {
                              selectedLang.parentNode.classList.add("theme-selected");
                          }

                          // The path to the root, taking the current
                          // language into account.
                          let full_path_to_root = "../../";
                          // The page path (mdbook only gives us
                          // access to the path to the Markdown file).
                          let path = "bounty/0.md".replace(/\.md$/, ".html");
                          for (let lang of langList.querySelectorAll("a")) {
                              if (lang.id == "en") {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${path}&nbsp;;
                              } else {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${lang.id}/${path}&nbsp;;
                              }
                          }
                        </script>

                        <h1 id="ordinal-bounty-0"><a class="header" href="#ordinal-bounty-0">Ordinal Bounty 0</a></h1>
<h2 id="criteria"><a class="header" href="#criteria">Criteria</a></h2>
<p>Magpadala ng isang sat na ang ordinal na numero ay nagtatapos sa isang zero sa address ng pagsusumite:</p>
<p>✅: <a href="https://ordinals.com/ordinal/1857578125803250">1857578125803250</a></p>
<p>❌: <a href="https://ordinals.com/ordinal/1857578125803251">1857578125803251</a></p>
<p>Ang sat ay dapat ang unang sat ng output na iyong ipinadala.</p>
<h2 id="reward"><a class="header" href="#reward">Reward</a></h2>
<p>100,000 sats</p>
<h2 id="submission-address"><a class="header" href="#submission-address">Submission Address</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://mempool.space/address/1PE7u4wbDP2RqfKN6geD1bG57v9Gj9FXm3"><code>1PE7u4wbDP2RqfKN6geD1bG57v9Gj9FXm3</code></a></p>
<h2 id="status"><a class="header" href="#status">Status</a></h2>
<p>Claimed ni <a href="https://twitter.com/rodarmor/status/1560793241473400833">@count_null</a>!</p>

                    </main>

        <!-- Provide site root to javascript -->
        <script>
            var path_to_root = "../";
            var default_theme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches ? "coal" : "coal";
        </script>

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

        <input type="checkbox" id="sidebar-toggle-anchor" class="hidden">

        <!-- Hide / unhide sidebar before it is displayed -->
        <script>
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            var sidebar = null;
            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

<p>Ang transaksyon na nagsusumite ng UTXO na naglalaman ng pinakamatandang sat, ibig sabihin, na may pinakamababang bilang, sa lahat ng isinumiteng UTXO ay huhusgahan ang winner.</p>
<p>Bukas ang bounty para sa mga pagsusumite hanggang block 753984-ang unang block ng difficulty adjustment period 374. Kasama ang mga pagsusumite sa block 753984 o pataas ay hindi isasaalang-alang.</p>

            var path_to_root = "../";

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

            var body = document.querySelector('body');

            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>

<html lang="fil" class="coal" dir="ltr">

        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../tomorrow-night.css">
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../ayu-highlight.css">

        <!-- Custom theme stylesheets -->
        <link rel="stylesheet" href="../language-picker.css">

    </head>
    <body class="sidebar-visible no-js">
    <div id="body-container">
        <!-- Provide site root to javascript -->
        <script>
            var path_to_root = "../";
            var default_theme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches ? "coal" : "coal";
        </script>

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

        <input type="checkbox" id="sidebar-toggle-anchor" class="hidden">

        <!-- Hide / unhide sidebar before it is displayed -->
        <script>
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            var sidebar = null;
            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

        <!-- Track and set sidebar scroll position -->
        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>

                        <script>
                          let langToggle = document.getElementById("language-toggle");
                          let langList = document.getElementById("language-list");
                          langToggle.addEventListener("click", (event) => {
                              langList.style.display = langList.style.display == "block" ? "none" : "block";
                          });
                          let selectedLang = document.getElementById("fil");
                          if (selectedLang) {
                              selectedLang.parentNode.classList.add("theme-selected");

                          // The path to the root, taking the current
                          // language into account.
                          let full_path_to_root = "../../";
                          // The page path (mdbook only gives us
                          // access to the path to the Markdown file).
                          let path = "bounty/3.md".replace(/\.md$/, ".html");
                          for (let lang of langList.querySelectorAll("a")) {
                              if (lang.id == "en") {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${path}&nbsp;;
                              } else {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${lang.id}/${path}&nbsp;;
                              }
                          }
                        </script>

                        link.setAttribute('tabIndex', sidebar === 'visible' ? 0 : -1);

                <div id="content" class="content">
                    <main>
                        <h1 id="ordinal-bounty-3"><a class="header" href="#ordinal-bounty-3">Ordinal Bounty 3</a></h1>
<h2 id="criteria"><a class="header" href="#criteria">Criteria</a></h2>
<p>Ang Ordinal bounty 3 ay may dalawang bahagi, na parehong nakabatay sa <em>ordinal names</em>.Ang mga ordinal names ay isang modified base-26 encoding ng ordinal numbers. Upang maiwasan ang pag-lock ng shot names sa loob ng unspendable genesis block coinbase reward, ordinal names ay maagiging <em>shorter</em> habang ang ordinal number ay nagiging <em>longer</em>. Ang pangalan ng sat 0, ang unang sat na na-mina ay <code>nvtdijuwxlp</code> at ang pangalan ng sat ay 2,099,999,997,689,999, ang huling sat na miminahin, ay <code>a</code>.</p>
<p>Bukas ang bounty para sa mga pagsusumite hanggang block 840000-ang unang block pagkatapos ng fourth halvening. Ang mga pagsusumite na kasama sa block 840000 o mas bago ay hindi ikonsidera.</p>
<p>Ang parehong bahagi ay gumagamit ng <a href="frequency.tsv">frequency.tsv</a>, isang listahan ng mga salita at ang bilang ng beses na nangyari ang mga ito sa <a href="http://storage.googleapis.com/books/ngrams/books/datasetsv2.html">Google Books Ngram dataset</a>. na-filter lamang sa isama ang mga pangalan ng sats na mamimina sa pagtatapos ng panahon ng pagsusumite, na lilitaw nang hindi bababa sa 5000 beses sa corpus.</p>
<p>Ang <code>frequency.tsv</code> ay isang file ng mga tab-separated values. Ang unang column ay ang word, at ang pangalawa ay ang bilang ng beses na ito ay lumabas sa corpus. Ang entries ay pinagsunod-sunod mula sa hindi pinakamadalas na nangyayari hanggang sa pinaka-madalas nangyayari.</p>
<p>Ang <code>frequency.tsv</code> ay compiled gamit ang <a href="https://github.com/casey/onegrams">program na ito</a>.</p>
<p>Upang maghanap ng <code>ord</code> wallet para sa sats na may pangalan sa <code>frequency.tsv</code>, gamitin ang sumusunod sa <a href="https://github.com/ordinals/ord"><code>ord</code></a> na command:</p>
<pre><code>ord wallet sats --tsv frequency.tsv
</code></pre>
<p>Ang command na ito ay nangangailangan ng sat index, kaya ang <code>--index-sats</code> ay dapat ipasa sa ord noong unang gumawa ng index.</p>
<h3 id="part-0"><a class="header" href="#part-0">Part 0</a></h3>
<p><em>Rare sats pair best with rare words.</em></p>
<p>Ang transaksyon na nagsusumite ng UTXO na naglalaman ng sat na ang pangalan ay lumalabas na may pinakamababang bilang ng occurrences sa <code>frequency.tsv</code> ang siyang mananalo ng part 0.</p>
<h3 id="part-1"><a class="header" href="#part-1">Part 1</a></h3>
<p><em>Popularity is the font of value.</em></p>
<p>Ang transaksyon na nagsusumite ng UTXO na naglalaman ng sat na ang pangalan ay lumalabas na may pinakamataas na bilang ng occurrences sa <code>frequency.tsv</code> ay ang nagwagi sa part 1.</p>
<h3 id="tie-breaking"><a class="header" href="#tie-breaking">Tie Breaking</a></h3>
<p>Sa kaso ng isang tie, kung saan ang dalawang pagsusumite ay nagaganap na may parehong frequency, ang naunang pagsusumite ay siyang mananalo.</p>
<h2 id="reward"><a class="header" href="#reward">Reward</a></h2>
<ul>
<li>Part 0: 200,000 sats</li>
<li>Part 1: 200,000 sats</li>
<li>Total: 400,000 sats</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="submission-address"><a class="header" href="#submission-address">Submission Address</a></h2>
<p><a href="https://mempool.space/address/17m5rvMpi78zG8RUpCRd6NWWMJtWmu65kg"><code>17m5rvMpi78zG8RUpCRd6NWWMJtWmu65kg</code></a></p>
<h2 id="status"><a class="header" href="#status">Status</a></h2>
<p>Unclaimed!</p>

                    </main>

                    <nav class="nav-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">
                        <!-- Mobile navigation buttons -->
                            <a rel="prev" href="../bounty/2.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters previous" title="Previous chapter" aria-label="Previous chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Left">
                                <i class="fa fa-angle-left"></i>
                            </a>


                        <div style="clear: both"></div>
                    </nav>
                </div>
            </div>

            <nav class="nav-wide-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">
                    <a rel="prev" href="../bounty/2.html" class="nav-chapters previous" title="Previous chapter" aria-label="Previous chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Left">
                        <i class="fa fa-angle-left"></i>
                    </a>

            </nav>

        </div>

        <!-- Track and set sidebar scroll position -->
        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>

                        <script>
                          let langToggle = document.getElementById("language-toggle");
                          let langList = document.getElementById("language-list");
                          langToggle.addEventListener("click", (event) => {
                              langList.style.display = langList.style.display == "block" ? "none" : "block";
                          });
                          let selectedLang = document.getElementById("fil");
                          if (selectedLang) {
                              selectedLang.parentNode.classList.add("theme-selected");
                          }

                          // The path to the root, taking the current
                          // language into account.
                          let full_path_to_root = "../";
                          // The page path (mdbook only gives us
                          // access to the path to the Markdown file).
                          let path = "contributing.md".replace(/\.md$/, ".html");
                          for (let lang of langList.querySelectorAll("a")) {
                              if (lang.id == "en") {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${path}&nbsp;;
                              } else {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${lang.id}/${path}&nbsp;;
                              }
                          }
                        </script>

                <script>
                    document.getElementById('sidebar-toggle').setAttribute('aria-expanded', sidebar === 'visible');
                    document.getElementById('sidebar').setAttribute('aria-hidden', sidebar !== 'visible');
                    Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('#sidebar a')).forEach(function(link) {
                        link.setAttribute('tabIndex', sidebar === 'visible' ? 0 : -1);

                    <main>
                        <h1 id="mag-ambag-sa-ord"><a class="header" href="#mag-ambag-sa-ord">Mag-ambag sa <code>ord</code></a></h1>
<h2 id="mga-iminungkahing-hakbang"><a class="header" href="#mga-iminungkahing-hakbang">Mga iminungkahing hakbang</a></h2>
<ol>
<li>Maghanap ng isyu na gusto mong ayusin.</li>
<li>Tukuyin kung ano ang magiging magandang unang hakbang patungo sa paglutas ng isyu. Ito ay maaaring nasa anyo ng code, pananaliksik, panukala, o sa pamamagitan ng pagmumungkahi na i-close ito, kung ito ay lipas na o hindi magandang ideya sa simula pa lang.</li>
<li>Magkomento sa problema, at humihingi ng feedback. Maaari kang sumali at magsimulang magsulat ng code o mag test, ngunit nakakatipid sa oras ang pagberipika kung ang paksa ay luma na, kung hindi ito malinaw, kung ito ay hindi pa handang ipatupad.</li>
<li>Kung ang isyu ay nangangailangan ng pagbabago ng code o pag-aayos sa isang bug, magbukas ng PR (pull request) draft na may kasamang test, at humingi ng feedback. Nakakatulong ito na matiyak na ang lahat ay sumasang-ayon sa kung ano ang kailangang gawin o ang unang hakbang sa paglutas ng problema. Dapat tandaan na ang paggawa ng tests at mahalaga upang madali at mabilis ma peripika ang iyong PR.</li>
<li>Gumawa ng maraming test, at i-tweak ang code hanggang sa handa na itong isumite.</li>
<li>Markahan ang PR ng “ready to review”.</li>
<li>Baguhin ang PR kung kinakailangan.</li>
<li>At sa huli, maari itong mai-merge!</li>
</ol>
<h2 id="magsimula-sa-maliit"><a class="header" href="#magsimula-sa-maliit">Magsimula sa maliit</a></h2>
<p>Ang mga maliliit pagbabago ay magbibigay-daan sayo na makapag-ambag ng mabilis, at kung hindi, hindi ka mag-aaksaya ng maraming oras.</p>
<p>Mga ideya:</p>
<ul>
<li>Magdagdag ng bagong test o test cases</li>
<li>Magdagdag o pagbutihin ang dokumentasyon</li>
<li>Maghanap ng isyu na nangangailangan ng higit pang pananaliksik, gawin ang pagsasaliksik na iyon, at ibuod ito sa isang komento.</li>
<li>Maghanap ng out-of-date na isyu.</li>
<li>Maghanap ng isyu na hindi dapat gawin, at magbigay ng constructive na feedback na nagdedetalye kung bakit sa tingin mo ay ganito ang sitwasyon.</li>
</ul>
<h2 id="mag-merge-nang-maaga-at-madalas"><a class="header" href="#mag-merge-nang-maaga-at-madalas">Mag-merge nang maaga at madalas</a></h2>
<p>Hatiin ang malalaking gawain sa mas maliliit na hakbang. Kung mayroong isang bug, maaari kang magbukas ng PR na nagdaragdag ng isang failing ignored test. Maaari itong i-merge, at ang susunod na hakbang ay ang pag-ayos ng bug at karagdagang tests. Magsagawa ng pananaliksik o pag-testing, at iulat ang iyong mga resulta. Hatiin ang isang feature sa maliliit na sub-feature at isa-isang i-fix ang mga ito.</p>
<p>Ang paghahanap ng paraan upang hatiin ang isang malaking PR sa mas maliliit na PR ay isang form of art na magandang practice bilang isang contributor. Ang mahirap na bahagi ay ang bawat PR ay dapat na isang improvement.</p>
<p>Sinisikap kong sundin ang payo na ito sa aking sarili, at palaging mas maganda kapag ginagawa ko.</p>
<p>Ang mga maliliit na changes ay mabilis na bumalangkas, nagre-rebisa, at nagsasama, na mas maganda kaysa sa pagtatrabaho sa isang malaking PR na tumatagal nang walang hanggan sa pag-draft, pagbabago, at pagsasama. Ang maliliit na changes ay hindi tumatagal ng maraming oras, kaya kung kailangan mong huminto sa paggawa sa isang maliit na changes, hindi ka magsasayang ng maraming oras kumpara sa isang mas malaking changes. Ang mabilis pag-PR ay nakakatulong na mapabuti ang proyekto kaagad, imbes na maghintay ng mahabang panahon para sa mas malaking changes. Ang maliliit na changes ay mas malamang na magdulot kakaunting conflict sa pagme-merge. Gaya ng sinabi ng mga taga-Athenians: <em>The fast commit what they will, the slow merge what they must.</em></p>
<h2 id="humingi-ng-tulong"><a class="header" href="#humingi-ng-tulong">Humingi ng tulong</a></h2>
<p>Kung natigil ka nang higit sa 15 minuto, humingi ng tulong, halimbawa sa Rust Discord, Stack Exchange, o sa project issue or discussion board.</p>
<h2 id="i-practice-ang-hypothesis-driven-debugging"><a class="header" href="#i-practice-ang-hypothesis-driven-debugging">I-practice ang hypothesis-driven debugging</a></h2>
<p>Bumuo ng hypothesis tungkol sa sanhi ng problema. Alamin kung paano i-test ang hypothesis na ito. Gawin ang test na ito. Kung ito ay gumana, maaari mong malutas ang problema o ngayon alam kung paano ayusin ito. Kung hindi, magsimulang muli sa isang bagong hypothesis.</p>
<h2 id="bigyang-pansin-ang-mga-mensahe-ng-error"><a class="header" href="#bigyang-pansin-ang-mga-mensahe-ng-error">Bigyang-pansin ang mga mensahe ng error</a></h2>
<p>Basahin ang lahat ng mga mensahe ng error at huwag i-tolerate ang mga warnings.</p>

                    </main>

                    <nav class="nav-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">
                        <!-- Mobile navigation buttons -->
                            <a rel="prev" href="faq.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters previous" title="Previous chapter" aria-label="Previous chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Left">

                            </a>

                            <a rel="next prefetch" href="donate.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters next" title="Next chapter" aria-label="Next chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Right">

                            </a>

                        <div style="clear: both"></div>

        <!-- Provide site root to javascript -->
        <script>
            var path_to_root = "";
            var default_theme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches ? "coal" : "coal";
        </script>

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

        <input type="checkbox" id="sidebar-toggle-anchor" class="hidden">

        <!-- Hide / unhide sidebar before it is displayed -->
        <script>
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            var sidebar = null;
            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

                            <i class="fa fa-globe"></i>
                        </button>
                        <ul id="language-list" class="theme-popup" aria-label="Languages" role="menu">
                          <li role="none"><button role="menuitem" class="theme">
                              <a id="en">English</a>
                          </button></li>
                          <li role="none"><button role="menuitem" class="theme">

                        <script>
                          let langToggle = document.getElementById("language-toggle");
                          let langList = document.getElementById("language-list");
                          langToggle.addEventListener("click", (event) => {
                              langList.style.display = langList.style.display == "block" ? "none" : "block";
                          });
                          let selectedLang = document.getElementById("fil");
                          if (selectedLang) {
                              selectedLang.parentNode.classList.add("theme-selected");
                          }

                          // The path to the root, taking the current
                          // language into account.
                          let full_path_to_root = "../";

                          // access to the path to the Markdown file).
                          let path = "digital-artifacts.md".replace(/\.md$/, ".html");
                          for (let lang of langList.querySelectorAll("a")) {
                              if (lang.id == "en") {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${path}&nbsp;;
                              } else {
                                  lang.href = &nbsp;${full_path_to_root}${lang.id}/${path}&nbsp;;
                              }
                          }
                        </script>

                    document.getElementById('sidebar').setAttribute('aria-hidden', sidebar !== 'visible');
                    Array.from(document.querySelectorAll('#sidebar a')).forEach(function(link) {
                        link.setAttribute('tabIndex', sidebar === 'visible' ? 0 : -1);
                    });

                <div id="content" class="content">
                    <main>
                        <h1 id="digital-artifacts"><a class="header" href="#digital-artifacts">Digital Artifacts</a></h1>
<p>Isipin ang isang pisikal na artifact. Ang isang rare na barya, halimbawa, ay itinatago sa loob ng maraming taon sa dilim, lihim na pagkakahawak ng isang Viking hoard, na ngayon ay hinukay mula sa lupa sa pamamagitan ng iyong mga kamay na nakahawak. Ito...</p>
<p>...ay may may-ari. Ikaw. Hangga't pinapanatili mo itong ligtas, walang sinuman ang makakakuha nito mula sa iyo.</p>
<p>...ay kumpleto. Wala itong nawawalang bahagi.</p>
<p>...ay mapapalitan mo lang. Kung ikaw ay isang mangangalakal, at nagpunta ka sa ika-18 siglong Tsina, maaari mong tatakan ito ng iyong chop-mark.</p>
<p>...ay maaari mo itapon. Ang pagbebenta, pangangalakal, o regalo, sa sinumang nais mo.</p>
<p>Ano ang mga digital artifact? Sa madaling salita, sila ang digital na katumbas ng mga pisikal na artifact.</p>
<p>Para maging isang digital na artifact ang isang digital na bagay, dapat itong katulad ng barya mo:</p>
<ul>
<li>
<p>Maaaring magkaroon ng mga may-ari ang mga digital artifact. Ang isang numero ay hindi isang digital na artifact, dahil walang sinuman ang maaaring magmay-ari nito.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Kumpleto ang digital artifact. Ang isang NFT na nasa off-chain na IPFS o Arweave ay hindi kumpleto, at sa gayon ay hindi isang digital na artifact.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ang mga digital artifact ay permissionless. Ang isang NFT na hindi maaaring ibenta nang hindi nagbabayad ng royalty ay hindi permissionless, at sa gayon ay hindi isang digital artifact.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ang mga digital artifact ay uncensorable. Marahil ay maaari mong baguhin ang isang database entry sa isang sentralisadong ledger ngayon, ngunit maaaring hindi bukas, at sa gayon ang isa ay hindi maaaring maging isang digital artifact.</p>
</li>
<li>
<p>Ang mga digital artifact ay hindi nababago. Ang isang NFT na may upgrade key ay hindi isang digital artifact.</p>
</li>
</ul>
<p>Ang kahulugan ng isang digital artifact ay nilayon upang ipakita kung ano <em>dapat</em> ang mga NFT, kung minsan, at kung <em>ano</em> ang inskripsiyon, ayon sa kanilang likas na katangian.</p>

                    </main>

                    <nav class="nav-wrapper" aria-label="Page navigation">
                        <!-- Mobile navigation buttons -->
                            <a rel="prev" href="overview.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters previous" title="Previous chapter" aria-label="Previous chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Left">
                                <i class="fa fa-angle-left"></i>
                            </a>

                            <a rel="next prefetch" href="inscriptions.html" class="mobile-nav-chapters next" title="Next chapter" aria-label="Next chapter" aria-keyshortcuts="Right">
                                <i class="fa fa-angle-right"></i>
                            </a>

                        <div style="clear: both"></div>
                    </nav>

                    </a>

        <!-- Provide site root to javascript -->
        <script>
            var path_to_root = "";
            var default_theme = window.matchMedia("(prefers-color-scheme: dark)").matches ? "coal" : "coal";
        </script>

        <!-- Work around some values being stored in localStorage wrapped in quotes -->
        <script>
            try {
                var theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme');
                var sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar');

                if (theme.startsWith('"') && theme.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-theme', theme.slice(1, theme.length - 1));
                }

                if (sidebar.startsWith('"') && sidebar.endsWith('"')) {
                    localStorage.setItem('mdbook-sidebar', sidebar.slice(1, sidebar.length - 1));
                }
            } catch (e) { }
        </script>

        <!-- Set the theme before any content is loaded, prevents flash -->
        <script>
            var theme;
            try { theme = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-theme'); } catch(e) { }
            if (theme === null || theme === undefined) { theme = default_theme; }
            var html = document.querySelector('html');
            html.classList.remove('coal')
            html.classList.add(theme);
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            body.classList.remove('no-js')
            body.classList.add('js');
        </script>

        <input type="checkbox" id="sidebar-toggle-anchor" class="hidden">

        <!-- Hide / unhide sidebar before it is displayed -->
        <script>
            var body = document.querySelector('body');
            var sidebar = null;
            var sidebar_toggle = document.getElementById("sidebar-toggle-anchor");
            if (document.body.clientWidth >= 1080) {
                try { sidebar = localStorage.getItem('mdbook-sidebar'); } catch(e) { }
                sidebar = sidebar || 'visible';
            } else {
                sidebar = 'hidden';
            }
            sidebar_toggle.checked = sidebar === 'visible';
            body.classList.remove('sidebar-visible');
            body.classList.add("sidebar-" + sidebar);
        </script>

        <!-- Track and set sidebar scroll position -->
        <script>
            var sidebarScrollbox = document.querySelector('#sidebar .sidebar-scrollbox');
            sidebarScrollbox.addEventListener('click', function(e) {
                if (e.target.tagName === 'A') {
                    sessionStorage.setItem('sidebar-scroll', sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop);
                }
            }, { passive: true });
            var sidebarScrollTop = sessionStorage.getItem('sidebar-scroll');
            sessionStorage.removeItem('sidebar-scroll');
            if (sidebarScrollTop) {
                // preserve sidebar scroll position when navigating via links within sidebar
                sidebarScrollbox.scrollTop = sidebarScrollTop;
            } else {
                // scroll sidebar to current active section when navigating via "next/previous chapter" buttons
                var activeSection = document.querySelector('#sidebar .active');
                if (activeSection) {
                    activeSection.scrollIntoView({ block: 'center' });
                }
            }
        </script>
